info.description: This is the API for the Continuous Compliance Framework.
info.title: Continuous Compliance Framework API

get.description: Fetches an intervalled compliance report for findings that match the provided uuid. The report groups findings status over time and returns a list of compliance report groups.
get.summary: Get intervalled compliance report by finding uuid

post.description: Creates multiple findings in the CCF API, as well as their subject and component counterparts.

get.description: Searches for findings and groups them by control class
get.summary: Search findings grouped by control class

post.description: Fetches an intervalled compliance report for findings that match the provided label filter. The report groups findings status over time and returns a list of compliance report groups.
post.summary: Get intervalled compliance report by search

get.description: Fetches up to 200 findings (ordered by Collected descending) that share the same stream UUID.
get.summary: Get finding history by stream UUID

get.description: Retrieves all unique control classes found in the stored findings
get.summary: List unique control classes from findings

post.description: Searches for findings using label filters.
Searches for findings, and groups them by subject

get.description: Fetches a finding based on its internal ID.

post.description: Creates multiple observations in the CCF API, along with their subject and component counterparts.

get.description: Fetches up to 200 observations (ordered by Collected descending) that share the same stream UUID.
get.summary: Get observation history by stream UUID

get.description: Fetches an observation based on its internal ID.
Retrieves a list of all subjects from the database.
Fetches a subject based on its internal ID.

delete.description: Deletes a subject from the database based on its internal ID.

patch.description: Updates a subject's title and/or remarks based on the provided subject ID. Only title and remarks are updated if provided. If no fields are provided, a `400 Bad Request` is returned.
patch.summary: Update a subject's title and/or remarks

scopes.description: Scopes can be either `Condition` or nested `Query`.

_id.description: ID is the unique ID for this specific observation, and will be used as the primary key in the database.

components.description: Which components of the subject are being judged

labels.description: Labels represent the unique labels which can be used to filter for findings in the UI.

observations.description: Which observations led to this judgment ?

risks.description: Which risks are associated with what we've tested

status.description: What is our conclusion drawn for this finding. satisfied | not-satisfied

subjects.description: What are we making a judgement against

uuid.description:
UUID needs to remain consistent when automation runs again, but unique for each subject.
It represents the "stream" of the same finding being made over time.

_id.description: ID is the unique ID for this specific observation, and will be used as the primary key in the database.

activities.description: What steps did we take to make this observation

components.description: Which components of the subject are being observed

uuid.description:
UUID needs to remain consistent when automation runs again, but unique for each subject.
It represents the "stream" of the same observation being made over time.

href.description: If a Href is specified here, it means we are referencing a common risk, and should be pulled from there.

status.description: The status for the risk. This can either be open|closed based on whether the risk is active or not.

threat-ids.description:
These threats relate to well known threats like phishing emails, brute force attacks, etc. often detailed
by cyber-security organisations.
